<jdz@...> writes:

> I don't think Nihonto is particularly on the NRA's radar specifically.
> But it is the same issue fundamentally, the private possession of
> arms, whether the particular arms under consideration consist of the
> Pennsylvania farmer's hunting rifle, or the SF Bay area tech mogul's
> Ichimonji daito. 

I am curious to know if the NRA has ever intervened into any laws
regarding swords, or knives. 

A lot of the slippery slope logic doesn't necessarily follow. That is,
there are counterexamples of countries with banned assault weapons and
legal firearms.

- darcy
